abstract: The chairman of the Federal Communications Commission hopes that sanctioning Comcast for slowing the use of file-sharing software on its Internet connections will set a precedent for all sorts of networks. His view is that phone companies, Internet providers and even cable TV systems can’t tell customers what content they can see and what devices they can use.
